Description: Shoulder/body sherd of black figure North Ionian pottery closed (?) vessel; interior: unglazed; exterior: white slip (mostly lost); heads, necks and wither area of two horses to left, the further one tossing its head up, with its teeth bared and its ears flat back (short incised strokes between the cheek and neck give the appearance of a lion's mane); the bridles are in black silhouette; the horses appear to have been painted red of which traces remain; the reins are thin orange lines; above the picture is a black line and traces of something (animal feet?) on the shoulder.
Curator's comments: Possibly from the same vase as B103.3 (GR 1888.6-1.460h and i), showing pairs of horses' legs to left; B103.4.3 may also belong.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.965)
